title.narrative: EIB EPTATF -Eastern Partership Technical Assistance Trust Fund: Eap
EIB EPTATF-Eastern Partnership Technical AssistanceTrust Fund: EaP

description.narrative:
Contribution is Swedens assistance via Sida to EIB trustfund EBTATF for technical assistande in project financed by EIB. Connected to environment and energy projects in Swedish focus countries.
Distribution: No country allocations in advance.

Insatsen avser svenskt bidrag via Sida till EIBs multifond Eastern Partnership Technical Assistance Trust Fund, EPTATF, för tekniskt bistånd i projekt som finansieras av Europeiska Investeringsbanken, EIB, inom ramen för EIBs verksamhet inom Östliga Partnerskapet.

EIB:The overall objective for the European Union's priorities in the East is prosperity, stability and safety, which also forms EIB's mandate for the Eastern Partnership. The Eastern Partnership Technical Assistance Trust Fund is a multi-year standing fund. Its purpose is to enable the European Investment Bank to provide technical assistance to improve the quality and development impact of the Bank's Eastern Partnership operations through targeted technical support. EPTATF:The EPTATF is expected to contribute to the following overall objectives: sustainable socio-economic development in Eastern Partnership Countries in line with the EIB’s revised external lending mandate; and capacity development in Eastern Partnership Countries(institutional, regulatory, organisational and individual) for preparation and implementation of infrastructure investments including urban development and climate change mitigation and adaptation.

tag.narrative: 11.2 - By 2030, provide access to safe, affordable, accessible and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety, notably by expanding public transport, with special attention to the needs of those in vulnerable situations, women, children, persons with disabilities and older persons.

11.2 - Senast 2030 tillhandahålla tillgång till säkra, ekonomiskt överkomliga, tillgängliga och hållbara transportsystem för alla. Förbättra trafiksäkerheten, särskilt genom att bygga ut kollektivtrafiken, med särskild uppmärksamhet på behoven hos människor i utsatta situationer, kvinnor, barn, personer med funktionsnedsättning samt äldre personer.

6.4 - By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity.

6.4 - Till 2030 väsentligt effektivisera vattenanvändningen inom alla sektorer samt säkerställa hållbara uttag och en hållbar försörjning med sötvatten för att angripa vattenbristen och väsentligt minska det antal människor som lider av vattenbrist.

description.narrative: Total resources of EPTATF at present amounts to around 40.7 MEUR, of which 36 MEUR have been allocated /approved for projects by the end of 2020. Out of this, 41 % has been allocated to projects in Ukraine, 17 % to Georgia, 15 % to Moldova, 10 % to Armenia, 10 % to regional projects and finally 7 % to projects in Belarus. Water and municipal infrastructure are the largest sectors with 28 and 17 % of the fund resources by end 2020. So far 15 operations have been completed and 24 are ongoing or delayed. Examples of completed operations are a traffic concept and marketing study the Dniepropetrovsk Metro in Ukraine and regional Technical Assistance (TA) consultants in Yerevan and Kiev supporting EIB to prepare and follow-up consultancy assignments for preparation and implementation of EIB loans in all of the countries in the Eastern Partnership region. Examples on ongoing operations are;1) Technical assistance to the Mykolayiv Vodokanal (MV) project in Ukraine. EIB has a loan to MV in the amount of 15.6 MEUR for upgrading of the water and waste water infrastructure. EPTATF finances consultants that are supporting MV in the implementation of this project. The grant for this consultancy assignment was approved already in 2011, and due to delays in the project implementation the consultancy assignment has been extended and expanded several times. According to the latest estimates the project will now be completed mid 2023. So far EIB has disbursed 5 MEUR (32%) of it loan. 2) Promoting climate action for SME:s through the banking sector in Georgia. EIB is providing 50 MEUR in credit lines for 3 Georgian banks that will be onlent to SME:s for climate related investments. The technical assistance financed by EPTATF will assist the three banks in improving their product offerings and enhance their capacity to provide financing to climate related investments. 3) Minsk wastewater treatment plan reconstruction. EIB is lending 84 MEUR to Minsk Vodokanal (MV) for this project, where EPTATF is financing consultants that will support MV with the implementation of this project. Given the latest political developments in Belarus all EIB-financed activities in the country is currently on hold. The technical assistance from EPTATF has so far supported EIB in mobilizing 4.9 bln EUR in lending to different projects in the region. So far EIB has disbursed 28% of the signed loans.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
